revised_title: Discrete Space Theory of Radiative Transfer: Fundamentals and Applications
tldr: The authors develop a formal theory of radiative transfer in one-dimensional scattering media of arbitrary physical constitution. They introduce an interaction principle that allows them to set up exact difference equations for reflection and transmission operators and radiation fields. The theory provides a framework for developing numerical techniques and algorithms for solving radiative transfer problems in more complex geometries and polychromatic scenarios.
